result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 3/21/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Any bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Straight time.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya Jefferson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. JM
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) gj

Defendant Tonya Jefferson in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sam Tufford under the student practice rules supervised by Kelly O'Neill  for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 28 days served; straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 3-21-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Any bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Defendant is REMANDED.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Tonya Jefferson not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  RESERVE BRANCH 21 FOR JUDGE SIEFERT, BRANCH 47.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains the same.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart at 5825 W Hope Avenue, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Tonya Jefferson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Tonya Jefferson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tonya Jefferson not in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Tonya Jefferson not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant called on 2-20-2015, at 10:45 she has been in the hospital since 2-18-2015 and she will be released on 2-21-2015. We informed her that she will have to be here on Monday 2-23-2015, at 1:30 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/20/15 @ 1 PM
